item.description: Stablecoins and the Price Volatility Problem Cryptocurrencies typically experience high volatility due to the complexities in valuing them and their smaller market size as compared to traditional fiat currencies. Volatility makes them less suitable for applications, especially those involving financial products and services. Stablecoins are designed as solutions to minimize price volatility relative to other crypotocurrencies. Stablecoins are usually pegged to other currencies and can be easily redeemed for their respective collateral(s).
